reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Let's start by saying that finally, after the Isrotel Ambassador experience, I decided to start writing reviews after having used tripadvisor for a couple of years. And this is pretty much all I have to say in favor of this experience.
reviews.title: disrespectful and arrogant, worst experience ever.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We booked through tripadvisor>>booking.com a sea view room with balcony. Arrived at the hotel (around 10pm) we were checked in and asked to pay for the whole stay (3nights) in advance. A bit surprised we agreed and were issued an invoice for a different amount (more than the one shown in the booking.com reservation) and briefly explained that it was because of the exchange rate and blablabla (lots of meaningless explanations) but that on the credit card bill it would be charged the correct amount. Apart from offending what I consider being my average intelligence (if you charge me a sum, that's what the credit card company will charge as well, right?!) I found inappropriate the tone in which we were addressed, rude and arrogant as per title.
reviews.title: Wonderful vacation for family with teens

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Being in our late 20's doesn't necessarily make us mates nor gives you the right to lecture us.
reviews.title: Nearly Perfect - Isrotel Yam Suf

likes.disliked: — The climate control in the room was uneven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They agreed to undo the transaction and postpone the whole payment instead of charging us the correct amount, so that it would become someone else's problem.
reviews.title: A quiet spot in Eilat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Let's move on.. of course the room wasn't what we had booked, the view was that of a wall next to the swimming pool and there was no terrace.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel...but not so good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We just returned from a 3 night stay at the Ambassador Hotel. The
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

likes.liked: — staff and the outdoor lobby area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: hotel is lovely. We rented 3 rooms and opted to pay a bit more for rooms with views. It was well worth it. Each room was nicely sized with a double bed and couch that pulled out into a bed. Each balcony looked out at the pool and the water.
reviews.title: A perfect hotel experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: The food was plentiful, delicious, and well presented. Over the 6 meals eaten, each was varied and different from the prior days selection.
reviews.title: A just ok hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008
reviews.text: Most notable was the staff at the hotel. They went out of their way to make sure we were comfortable and our needs met. Two of my children have special dietary needs, and Noga (at reception) went way beyond the call of duty making sure they had what they needed.
reviews.title: Good to stay out of the main hotels area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We even got a call from the manager when we got home to follow up on a comment we had left on the check out form. I have never seen that happen in Israel before.
reviews.title: Not on the Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: Like two other recent reviews, I stayed here the night before I went to Petra and then two nights after. I, too, objected to the strong air freshener smeel on entering the hotel. The room the first night I stayed was very nice - in one of the hight rise beuildings. When I returned they assigned me to a room on the ground floor near the pool area - cardk, dinghy, small, needed refurbishing. I refused to accept the room and after much fighting with the reception staff, was assigned a room on the third floor of the pool area. This room was satisfactory. It was a very busy week in Eilat as it was a holiday week for Israeli schooldhildren and all of Israel was on vacation in Eilat! Reception staff could not handle the many problems and it took forever for any question of reception. I knew that the hotel was off the beaten path of the high rise hotels, so I did not mind this, in fact, that was fine with me. This could be a nice hotel with some renovating and friendly reception staff.
reviews.title: Disappointing stay for a hotel rated #1 in Eilat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in Eilat for two nights while spending a full day touring Petra. I would not recommend this hotel. Upon entering the lobby, I noticed the strong smell of air freshener. It seemed to permeate the entire lobby. After a short line (that took a long time), we were on our way to our room. The view from the room was of the parking lot -- not exactly the view you would want when at the Red Sea. After upgrading for just a few dollars more, we were in a room with a balcony. I was relived that I no longer smelled the air freshener spray. The room and bathroom were adequate and clean. The bed was reasonably comfortable. We were there on a holiday week and there were many children some of whom were unruly and loud. Be sure to return your "towel cards" or you will be charged a $40 fee!! We didn't eat at the hotel but because we had an early trip to Petra, we were given box lunches to take along. Nice touch although not everything was edible. Internet was available for a fee -- there was not even free internet in the lobby. I was glad that there was an Aroma coffee shop at the front of the hotel so we could have reasonably priced and good food -- muesli, salads and coffee as well as free wi-fi. Good location across from Coral Beach -- great for snorkeling and scuba diving. Off the beaten hotel path of Eilat, but a 5 minute taxi ride away makes this not really an issue. Lobby furniture and decor were weathered (maybe because of the beach location). An OK hotel in an OK town. Reminded me of a cheaply built Las Vegas hotel minus the casinos. My husband and I tried our "shooting" skills at an on-site shooting range. Quite the experience! Great staff and instructors there. Don't miss Petra, though. Fabulous!!
reviews.title: High Expectations--Yam Suf did not deliver

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This hotel is excellent. The staff at this hotel was very friendly and helpful. It's located at the Corral Beach. Actually ths beach is across the street.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best feature of this hotel is its location across from Coral Beach, which is also one of its downsides. It is about 2 miles from the city center and there are almost no services, restaurants, etc. The hotel has not been updated in a while and the room's furniture was beginning to look worn. We came into a room with a broken air conditioner (later fixed), but one would assume they would have known this before we checked in (104 degrees outside). The staff was uniformly unhelpful, unfriendly and uninterested. They even argued that I had no reservation, even though I showed them the voucher (pre-paid) from their website. We only needed a one night stay before an early morning trip to Jordan, so this was an OK stay for the money. Note that everything was an additional charge. We ask how to get to the beach and were told "just go straight across the street". What they didn't say was they had a specific beach for guests and that lounges there were free. Also note that there is a "rule" that you have to use specific towel cards and if they are not returned (the cards!!) they charge you 40 NIS. Read the small print in the room card envelope! I think it is obvious that I do not recommend this property. My wife and I travel worldwide and know what hotels should be doing.
reviews.title: OK, but would not return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms have great views of the Red Sea, the staff is pleasant, the breakfast was tasty and the beach is right across the road. The hotel is south of Eilat and the atmosphere is much more relaxed than at the north beach hotels. Although I really enjoyed my stay, I'm rating the room as average because there was very little soundproofing between the rooms.
reviews.title: great vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got quality at the best possible price - quiet hotel near the city center, excellent food and friendly staff. The only shortcoming is early served breakfast, up to 10:30, with long ques as aperitif. Room cleaning can be improved, too. All in all, it surely deserves the stars put on the wall and I would definitely recommend it.
reviews.title: Great value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Would I drive down tomorrow (or fly)--yes. After spending a week at the hotel in July, going back is my first goal. And living in Israel that is easy. If I lived elsewhere, would I come again--absolutely
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Three key points:
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Nice Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: 1) Service. there is something special about the training program at Isrotel. In short, personnel say "Yes we can." And we they can't ehy explain carefully and why. For me, nothing tops that in selecting a hotel.
reviews.title: Bast Hotel in Eilat for Calm Vacation and Snorkeling

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: 2) Location. The Coral Beach in the southern part of Eilat--on the road to the Egyptian border. It is a far cry and short distance from the major hotels and honky tonk atmosphere at the head of the Gulf. The Isrotel Red Sea Hotel (Ambassador has been dropped from its name) reminded me of resorts I have been at in the Caribbean. Cross a road and your are on the beach.. Stay at the hotel and there or three great pools (adults, young children and toddlers). If scuba diving is your goal, proximity to the sea and quality of the on-site diving school make it the best in Eilat. I have tried others and the immaculate condition, fine instruction, good dive shop and attitude all stand out. If you want to chill by reading some good books (I finished five in a weekm this is the place)
reviews.title: Service and food excellent, but be aware of the location
